ai.summary: Dougalston Trail is a 9.2 km moderate hike in the UK, offering a pleasant woodland circuit with gentle climbs and varied terrain. The route suits hikers with some experience and provides shaded sections, brief viewpoints, and opportunities to observe local wildlife.
ai.terrain_summary: Forest and countryside paths with a mix of compact tracks and dirt trails. Expect gentle elevation changes, some roots and uneven sections, and occasional muddy patches after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Plan your day by checking weather and daylight hours. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Stay on marked paths, keep to the trail, and carry a map or GPS. Bring water and a small first aid kit. Have a charged phone and know how to call for help. Be mindful of other hikers and wildlife, and take care on wet or uneven sections, especially after rain.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or trail shoes
Map, compass or GPS device/phone with offline map
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late return)
Light rain cover or pack liner
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer and Autumn are ideal for this trail; Winter hikes are possible with proper gear and daylight considerations.
